data.text: @ugdsb Every school board should do this @PeelSchools

@ugdsb Lift mask mandates. Masks were the 1st tools used to prevent the spread obviously that didn’t work then vaccines and masks that didn’t work then test kits,vaccines and masks and kids are still getting covid 2 yrs later!Listen to public health once again…lift mask mandates!
@TiffHolmes @ugdsb EVERYONE deserves to live a life, the fact that you only care about your children and no one else’s is what makes you heartless.
@TiffHolmes @ugdsb Your take is basically “screw disabled people, I don’t care if you die. I’m not willing to wear a small piece of cloth over my face.”

@TiffHolmes @ugdsb It’s not as simple as that for immunocompromised people. The vaccine doesn’t work on a lot of us (myself included). Masks don’t protect the wearer, they stop you from breathing OUT covid. Your mask protects me, mine protects you.

@TiffHolmes @ugdsb None of the things I’m high risk for would kill me and the vaccines for them are more effective. Plus we aren’t in a global pandemic for them. Just because the virus isn’t going away doesn’t mean masks should. Taking precautions isn’t living in fear. It’s being realistic.

@erin @ugdsb We have dealt with the discomfort for 2 years… this is no longer a pandemic, it is time to open the economy, and get back to living a normal life, wasn’t that the end game to begin with… I really am sorry you are scared but you won’t change my mind. I hope you stay well. 🙏🏻

@TiffHolmes @ugdsb I’ve even had a lung biopsy in my mask since before the pandemic. Masks aren’t fun, but disabilities like mine where you have to have lung biopsies while wearing a mask are less fun. So just depends on if a little discomfort now is worth avoiding potentially a lot later.
